div.head:
N. A. C. W.National Association of Colored Women
Prepared especially for
... Clubs ...

Mary Fitzbutler Waring, M. D.
National Chairman

div.p:
If with intelligence and skill the
homemakers can learn to do the work
of dietitian, welfare worker and sani
tary inspector, much will be done to im
prove the world. We are not working
for our particular group, but through
improving our own we may set an ex
ample in right living that will make the
world a better place to live.

The progressive age in which we live
has made it necessary to give you, even
though briefly, a constructive program.
We realize that the child's intellectual
development is dependent on the physi
cal structure and moral attitude. There
for we are opening out yearly work
herafter with a program for Betterbetter
Homeshomes.

You are requested to hold meeting
and have concerted action the twenty-
second of September in a campaign for
this purpose.

"Westward the Starstar of Empireempire takes
its way."
Was said by someone of a by-gone
day.
But Looklook! The Starstar of Betterbetter Healthhealth
is near,
To shed its light upon you home,
right here.

Give more time, to the living condi
tions of the home. Use properly all the
things you possess. Train the children
to use their knife, fork, and spoon prop
erly. How to arrange flowers for beau
tiful
effect. What colors harmonize in
interior decoration. These all help to
mould character. This idea has been
splendidly outlined by Mrs. Sallie
Stewart, National President.

Shall we save the best silver for com
pany? Make the home a happy place
to live. Does it pay to always eat in
the kitchen? Should children have defi
nite duties to perform? Do mothers
need recreation? Should a father be
acquainted with his own children?

Is the moral attitude being kept up to
the high standard?

Emphasize - Environmentenvironment, Habitshabits,
Moralsmorals and Religionreligion.

Slogan: Aid suffering humanity be
fore it suffers

Preventive medicine has revolution
ized methods of practice. 'TisIt is better to
remain well than to attempt to cure
the ills that may invade the body. You
are urged to give attention to preven
tive medicine and prophylactic princi
ples.

To circulate literature on the care of
waste, ventilation, body protection, care
of mothers and children, and the need
of a knowledge of preventive medicine.

Vaccination and inoculation to pro
tect children from childhood diseases
and epidemics.

Vaccination prevent smallpox. Dick
test protects against scarlet fever.
Shick test protects against diphtheria
possibility. Toxin-antitoxin prevents
diphtheria. Antitoxin combartscombats diph
theria.
Tetanus antitoxin prevents lock
jaw. The above facts may be taken to
the humblest home and the knowledge
will prevent needless suffering and loss
of life. This is the work you can do and
do well.
Teeth-examine periodically.

Tonsils-Needed, but when diseased,
should be removed. Secondary infec
tion
and toxic conditions directrly trace
able to deseased teeth and tonsils.
Specific diseases.

Syphilis is a curable disease if taken
in time and persistently treated. It is
one of the few deseasesdiseases that a child
may be born with. The symptoms are
very easily percieved and should be
treated early.

It is no offense to be told you have
the disease but it is not only and offense
but a calamity to hide it and refuse to
take treatment for your own sake and
protection of others.

A communicable social disease which
is being better understood and yielding
to treatment. More common than you
would believe and more destructive to
happiness or health than most diseases.
The prophylactic protection of the
sight of new-born babies by legislation
in most states has greatly decreased the
number of blind children. Consult your
physician or the public clinic.
Tuberculosis.
Tuberculosis is a curable disease.

In many large cities Tuberculosis In
stitutes or Hospitals have been esta
blished;, in smaller places "Clinics" in
local hospitals. Literature may be had
for the asking at the local Health
Office.

Early diganosis in important. Hos
pitalization helpful and persistend teat
ment is necessary. Actinic, Ultra-violet
rays, diathermy, static electricity, and
sunshine are wonderful curative agents.

Open air sleeping apartments, work
shops and school rooms, where a num
ber of people are partients have been
very beneficial. Proper food, exercise
and clothing are helful preventives.
Collect information and broadcast

Negroes are no more susceptible to
"T. B.tuberculosis" than other people under similar
conditions

Splendid results have been obtained
from routine rest, dietetic and hygenic
measures in the early staged. Artifical
pneumothorax gives a hopeful and suc
cessful solution to cases formerly con
sidered incurable.

Better homes, happiness and pro
gress will all be aided by the club wo
men just after the holidays in their per
sonal contact work with the "Fellow in
need." There are millions of people
who would go on doing and living if
only given a chance to know. the cli
nic, the public welfare station, the visit
ing nurse, the big hearted doctor, each
is reaching out a helping hand. The
club woman can by personal contact
bring the helpers and the people to
gether. Much good will work may be
done by public lecture, teas, and get-
together meetings. The highest is not
very far above the lowest. The rich is
just next yard to the poor. The bad are
not very much worse than those we
deem good.
It is all relational value
and viewpoint
Psychiatry.

See to the birth registration of all
babies.

The health and care of children is so
important that most communities today
have systematic service of registration,
investigation and plans for the relief of
conditions that impair the healthy de
velopment of children. Centers, clinics
and welfare stations afford helpful in
structions and aid.

It is known that childhood diseases
are not necessary and immunity to
many contagious diseases may be es
tabilished by injections or vaccinations.

Heart affections are of great impor
tance from birth to old age. Contrib
uting causes are many and the subject
is now being helpfully considered by
specially organized agencies in large
cities
"Is life worth living"?
"It depends on the liver."

You see the liver eats food to nour
ish and enable the liver of the liver who
has the liver to form liver secretions
and if the liver does its work properly,
the liver is a joyful liver.

The appendix is very queer.
It does not know just why 'tisit is here.

All that it makes is stomach aches.
Surgeons though, hold it dear.

In the spring there are many agencies
that send out plans for helpful con
structive programs for "Better Health"
and the N. A. C. W.National Association of Colored Women should co-operate
in every possible way. Among the best
programs are those of the Medical
Association and Tuskegee.

Campaigns for cleaning up and ar
ranging for out door sports and recre
ation will give wonderful results.

Make summary of work, report to
this office, please.
Suggestions gratefully received.
My Friends:

For many years I have endeavored
to bring my people to a realization of
the importance of the work women in
the home and women in club work
may do Health Campaigns. Others
who shall come after me will have
easier work with the great improveimprovement

ment in hospital facilites and the
scientific discoveries which are con
stantly lessening the suffering oc
casioned by disease.

Kindly preserce this folder and pass
it on to some one who may find some>
helpful thought herein.

As a final reminder we urge peri
odical examinations to keep well in
